item.title: [HBASE-149] HBase shell JAR command kills shell
item.description:
After the JAR command runs successfully, it kills the shell, but any exceptions cause the shell to remain open.

Instead the shell should remain open in all cases so that it is not necessary to relaunch the shell to rerun the JAR.
item.summary: HBase shell JAR command kills shell

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Does the Main-Class in the job jar you are running call System.exit? (The hadoop pi example cited in the shell 'jar' command help does – see PiEstimator#main). If so, there is little the shell can do to.
My main class extends ToolBase, and is executed using ToolRunner. As far as I can tell, none of those classes call System.exit(), and neither does my code.

I do not see any mention of System.exit in Tool* classes. Odd though is that if I remove the System.exit from the pi sample, the shell is not exited when job run finishes:
